conclusion: The task is to predict whether liquid flowing from A, B, and C will end up in container D or E after passing through baffles.
Container A is positioned at the top left, container B is at the top center, and container C is at the top right.

There are several baffles in the image: an orange baffle slanting downwards to the right, a yellow baffle slanting downwards to the left, a red baffle slanting downwards to the right, a brown baffle slanting downwards to the left, and a gray baffle slanting downwards to the right.
At the bottom of the image, there are two containers labeled D and E, separated by a green divider.
The baffles create a pathway that directs the flow of liquid from the top containers (A, B, C) to the bottom containers (D, E).
Liquid from A will hit the orange baffle and be directed downwards to the left.
After hitting the orange baffle, liquid from A will encounter the yellow baffle, which will direct it downwards to the right.
Liquid from A will eventually flow into container D.
Liquid from B will hit the yellow baffle and be directed downwards to the left.
After hitting the yellow baffle, liquid from B will encounter the red baffle, which will direct it downwards to the right.
Liquid from B will eventually flow into container D.
Liquid from C will hit the red baffle and be directed downwards to the left.
After hitting the red baffle, liquid from C will encounter the brown baffle, which will direct it downwards to the right.
Liquid from C will eventually flow into container E.
